node.text: We are going to deal with our physical infrastructure. We are going to deliver for the needs of working families. Let's create the jobs. Let's expand Medicare. Let's lead the world in the fight against climate change. That's what we've got to do.

node.title: The infrastructure bill & the reconciliation bill must go forward together.

node.text: We have worked very hard to develop legislation which finally meets the long-neglected needs of the working class. $3.5 trillion is already the compromise — we must pass the infrastructure bill and the reconciliation bill in tandem.

node.title: We must meet the needs of the working class.

node.text:
Let me help my Republican colleagues understand who it is that we're going to be raising taxes for under our reconciliation bill.
✅ billionaires
✅ large corporations
❌ working families earning less than $400,000 a year

node.title: Yes, we're going to raise taxes on billionaires and large corporations.

node.text: Every powerful special interest and their lobbyists are flooding Capitol Hill to try to defeat the most consequential legislation for working people since the Great Depression. But if we stand together, we're going to defeat them and deliver for the working class.

node.title: Special interests & their lobbyists are united against us.

node.text: A recent poll found over 60 percent of people making under $50,000 a year support our reconciliation bill. Why? Because whether you are a working class Republican, Democrat, or Independent, at the end of the day, you want the federal government to finally respond to your needs.

node.title: Working class people understand the need for a decent-paying job.

node.text: Bernie stops at a local diner and starts an impromptu town hall on the reconciliation bill. Folks gather to ask questions - including former republicans.

node.text: I've said it before and I'll say it again: It is time for the Congress to finally have the guts to stand up to the wealthy and special interests, and restore the people's faith in the idea that our government can work for all of us.

node.title: We must stand up to the wealthy and the special interests.

node.text:
Since the start of the pandemic, billionaires in this country have gotten some $1.8 trillion richer, while half our people live paycheck to paycheck.

Please do not tell me that the billionaires of this country cannot afford to finally pay their fair share of taxes.

node.title: It's time for billionaires to pay their fair share.

node.text: In the face of so much devastation being wrought by decades of inaction, we cannot sit by and do nothing. When the Civilian Climate Corps is created, we will mobilize young people who care so deeply about the future of this planet to combat climate change.

node.title: Doing nothing on climate change is not an option.

node.text: We are going to deal with our physical infrastructure. We are going to deliver for the needs of working families. Let's create the jobs. Let's expand Medicare. Let's lead the world in the fight against climate change. That's what we've got to do.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Bernie Sanders on September 13, 2021. May be an image of one or more people, outdoors and text that says 'Moments like these are the moments that test our mettle. The question before usะ will we stand together & fight for economio justice, for social justice, for racial justice, & for environmental justice? Bumi'.

node.text: If we can stand together, yes, we will move this country forward.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Bernie Sanders on September 13, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'California: Reject the right-wing power grab Bernie'.

node.text:
Let me be as clear as I can be — the attempted recall of Governor Newsom is nothing more than a bold-faced Republican power grab. If we have any hope at all of addressing climate change, guaranteeing health care to all, and passing real immigration reform — we cannot let them succeed.

California: return your ballot or vote 'NO' in-person by tomorrow, September 14.

node.text: We have worked very hard to develop legislation which finally meets the long-neglected needs of the working class. $3.5 trillion is already the compromise — we must pass the infrastructure bill and the reconciliation bill in tandem.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Bernie Sanders on September 11, 2021. May be a Twitter screenshot of text that says 'Bernie Sanders @BernieSanders We are not going to build bridges just so our peope can live under them. No infrastructure bill without the $3.5 trillion reconciliation bill.'.

Photo by Bernie Sanders on September 11, 2021. May be a Twitter screenshot of text that says 'Bernie Sanders @BernieSanders We pause today to remember the thousands of lives lost on September 11, 2001, and honor the bravery of the first responders who put their lives at risk to save others.'.

Photo by Bernie Sanders on September 10, 2021. May be a Twitter screenshot of text that says 'Bernie Sanders @BernieSanders If we do not move aggressively to combat climate change and if we allow the planet to become increasingly unlivable, we will be showing absolute contempt for our younger generation. It would be grossly immoral to turn our backs on our kids and grandchildren. We must act now.'.

Photo by Bernie Sanders on September 10, 2021. May be an image of 1 person and text that says 'IS IT ACCEPTABLE TO YOU that while 2 people own more wealth than the bottom 40% in this country, half our people live paycheck to paycheck, seniors are unable to hear or to see the world world around them, and new moms are guaranteed ZERO paid days to spend with their baby? Seme'.

node.text:
To me, the level of inequality in the United States today is morally unconscionable.

Now is the time for legislation that says yes, in the richest country on the face of the planet, seniors must be able to age with dignity — we must expand Medicare to cover hearing aids, dental care, and eyeglasses.

Now is the time for legislation which says yes, it is absurd that the United States is the only major country not to guarantee workers some form of paid family and medical leave — we must end that absurdity and guarantee paid leave to workers.

Now is the time to enact the most consequential legislation for the working class of this country since the days of Franklin Delano Roosevelt and the New Deal.

Now is the time for working class solidarity. Now is the time to finally build a government which works for all of us.

node.text:
Let me help my Republican colleagues understand who it is that we're going to be raising taxes for under our reconciliation bill.
✅ billionaires
✅ large corporations
❌ working families earning less than $400,000 a year

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Bernie Sanders on September 08, 2021. May be an image of ‎text that says '‎We have a choice to make. WE CAN LISTEN TO THE CLIMATE DENIERS AND NOT WORRY ABOUT THE IMPACT OF CLIMATE CHANGE AND TURN OUR BACKS ON OUR KIDS AND GRANDKIDS. OR WE CAN LISTEN TO THE SCIENTISTS WHO TELL US THAT WE MUST ACT BOLDLY AND AGGRESSIVELY TO PREVENT A CLIMATE خسدS CATASTROPHE.‎'‎.

node.text: We have a choice to make.

node.text: Every powerful special interest and their lobbyists are flooding Capitol Hill to try to defeat the most consequential legislation for working people since the Great Depression. But if we stand together, we're going to defeat them and deliver for the working class.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Bernie Sanders on September 07, 2021. May be a Twitter screenshot of text that says 'Bernie Sanders @BernieSanders Today in America: -the two richest people own more wealth than the bottom 40% -the top 1% owns more wealth than the bottom 92% -45% of all new income has gone to the top 1% since 2009 Is that the kind of economy any working person ought to be satisfied with?'.
